newsitem.title: INDIA: India RBI says seeks to build forex reserves.
newsitem.headline: India RBI says seeks to build forex reserves.

text.p: Interventions by India's central bank in the country's forex markets are designed to help boost foreign currency reserves, a senior bank official told Reuters Financial Television on Friday.
Deputy Governor Y.V. Reddy of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), said that RBI intervention is designed to ensure that the rupee's exchange rate reflects the ecnomy's fundamentals.
"We are in the market to curb excess volatility," he said in reply to a question. "We are also in the business of building adequate reserves."
The objectives of RBI's intervention in forex markets also encompassed the development of the foreign exchange market, Reddy said.

But this policy has to be used in conjunction with RBI's money supply strategies, he added. RBI's buying of dollars pumps rupees into the economy and has the effect of increasing India's money supply.
